title: Now that we have a badass Shen splash art, can have a discussion about his rework?
body:
Credits to Afrocream for the awesome art.

Now on to the core of the subject: why is Shen untouched so far in the current meta? Patch 5.2, why are we still arguing about Zed and Lee-sin or even Sona in the forums? Why is Shen so barely seen and played? Why do we absolutely need a Duo-queue in order for a good Shen player to perform? What is he lacking? Too much skill involved for the rewards? You miss a taunt and fear to get reported? I just don't understand why my favorite champion feels unplayable at the moment. 

It seems like Riot has forgotten the tanks they have created initially, only to be replaced by nearly-broken AP "battle mages" (or AP-bruisers). Am I the only one feeling like this? Any ideas on how we can have Shen shine again in the top lane? Even the jungle lane? Should I be going full AP just like the current trend?!

Thanks for the construction ideas coming in, let's please stay civil and remember,

Stand United.

replies.body:
Actually i read a Red comment somewhere in the last week or two about him that literally said this. I'll be paraphrasing, but the meaning is intact.

"We would like to rework Shen, but we're not sure how to go about it. First of all we dont know exactly how to define his role since he's tanky, and yet a ninja. His kit however doesnt really exemplify that of a ninja at all and really just seems like a bundle of stats. If we ever do rework him, and we might, we would first have to address exactly what role we would like him to fill and how we could retain his core character without changing him too drastically. We believe we would keep his ult as we believe that a ninja suddenly appearing by an ally is thematically good and completely iconic for the character.

one of our biggest issues however is that not only are we unsure of which direction we want to take him, but current players in spite of his flaws find him fun to play regardless, which inevitably and sadly puts him low down on our list of priorities."

it was kind of sad to see as Shen is a character i deeply enjoy as well, which naturally forced me to relate to the Rioters last comment in that they struggle with what to do with him because people enjoy him as is, even if his kit does have a bit of an identity crisis and no major strengths.

I aslo remember having read a post about it, but after some researches I was not even able to find it again. Otherwise it would be in the main subject I've posted earlier as the initial reflexion. 

Is Shen fun to play? I LOVE him the way he is.

Now, is he competitive? No and here is why: he requires too much skill the average LoL player. You miss your ult, you get flamed. You miss your taunt AND flash (trying to get to that damn Kalista!!) you get flamed again. Shen simply demands too much for basically close to 0 rewards and its own because of his very little kill potential and his own.

He relies too much on his team mates in order for him to be successful in solo queue (to my very own experiences, if you do not agree, feel free to tell me otherwise).

Like I said, recently I have been running with lots of HPs runes and some attack speed along 2 quints of damage and 1 quint of MS, got a statik shiv for the waveclear, then a botrk for the dueling power AND finally went full tanky. Becaues of the few kills I had top early game only was I able to snowball and be a better tank.

Now imagine everything I just wrote down, but as a Gnar player. Or as a Lissandra player. Are you going to need an experimental build in order to be successful in solo queue? No. You go look up a guide on any website, get a good grab of their skills and you're all set to gain some elo.

His kit feels exactly like the ninja he is. Shen only needs a number overhaul, maybe new ways of regaining energy? Maybe tuning up or down his AP ratios? I would love to see a detailed answer from a Red here...

Stand United Shen players...

I took exhaust, it helps agiasnt trades and helps to get the kill with lower ms and resistances, and you can escape enemies even better with.

> Now, is he competitive? No and here is why: he requires too much skill the average LoL player.

I don't think that's a good enough reason to explain why he isn't competitive. The top pro teams would play a champ if they're good, regardless if they "require too much skill". No one plays Shen in pro play, therefore the only conclusion I can come to at this time is that he's just not seen as good by anyone at the moment. At least, they don't see him as bringing anything to the table that other champions don't already bring in a better way.

What I personally think is the problem with him is his kit. Well, half of it at least. 

His Q and W are next to useless. 

* His Q is good for some lane sustain, but that's about it. It does very little damage, has no other utility to it other than healing whoever hits the marked target (and the healing itself is of a very small amount), and it being a point-and-click damage ability makes it hard to make it feel good to use and good to play against. 

* His W gives him such a small shield, it becomes useless outside of the laning phase, much like his Q. Again, like his Q, there's no real gameplay to it, just press W and you get the full effect instantly. 

If they were to keep anything in his kit, it should be his E and R. Those make him exciting to play, and those allow him to change the game through the use of player skill. The sad thing is it's only half of his kit. :(

I agree that Shen isn't very strong right now, but I feel that his Q and W are quite useful.

They just might feel less useful. His shield lets his get his passive damage back at double speed if unbroken, and if unbroken, could be reworded as "Take less damage on the next exchange. For just a short cooldown" Also get energy back when broken. Its a good move. Its just kept weak because shens ult is just that strong.

If his ult really is taking up all of his "power real estate", then perhaps a bit of a rework for it is in order?

Something that came to mind would be something like, keep the teleportation to an allied champion, but maybe lower the shield it gives (or get rid of it entirely), and instead have a large percentage of any damage done to the champ Shen is ulting to instead be dealt to Shen himself. This would encourage Shen to build tanky still, while giving a sort of counter play to the ult (focus the guy getting ulted to do some damage to both them and to Shen). It might overall end up reducing less damage than normal, but I think that would free up some "power" that could spread to the rest of his kit.

Another thing they could do to free up some power is reduce (or completely remove) the damage dealt on his taunt. I honestly didnt even know it did damage until I looked it up just now. Why does it do damage? Does it need to do damage? 

As for his Q and W, I think they just need to be something that's more coherent with the rest of his kit, because right now they're kind of just there. Yes his W helps his passive come back up faster and that helps him restore some energy, but I think they can think of something else that's more fun/useful.

Q and W are quite coherent in my opinion. Q feeds into tanking and autoattacking which synergizes with W which you want to autoattack during, which in turn feeds into his passive. These were just all nerfed into pointlessness because of that damn ulti.

> Another thing they could do to free up some power is reduce (or completely remove) the damage dealt on his taunt. I honestly didnt even know it did damage until I looked it up just now. Why does it do damage? Does it need to do damage?

Removing damage would actually be a buff. It does damage so that Shen takes tower aggro while taunting.

>If his ult really is taking up all of his "power real estate", then perhaps a bit of a rework for it is in order?

And the Shen ult rework you suggest is a good first step, but the fact is that as long as Shen can teleport to a friendly champion across global range he will never get to feel satisfying to play. That simple effect is so strong that even if shens ult had NO damage mitigation at all it would still be good.

As I posted earlier, I am a fan of truly gutting that ult so that shen can have some strength elsewhere.

> Q and W are quite coherent in my opinion. Q feeds into tanking and autoattacking which synergizes with W which you want to autoattack during, which in turn feeds into his passive. These were just all nerfed into pointlessness because of that damn ulti.

> Removing damage would actually be a buff. It does damage so that Shen takes tower aggro while taunting.

> And the Shen ult rework you suggest is a good first step, but the fact is that as long as Shen can teleport to a friendly champion across global range he will never get to feel satisfying to play. That simple effect is so strong that even if shens ult had NO damage mitigation at all it would still be good.

I feel he needs a rework, but not because he is bad.
**Shen has a monkey on his back called Stand United.**
While his kit may need deeper work, I argue that a disproportionately large part of Shen's kit power is spent on that damn ult.

***TLDR: I think his ult needs changed. It needs to not be global, and needs to be more forgiving. It just takes up too much of his power budget.***

Yes its high skillcap, yes it is gamechangingly powerful, but unfortunately every part of Shen is kept weak.

His Q does minimal damage, his passive has poor base and scaling, his E is long cooldown and punishingly high cost when missed, his shield is low power and poor scaling.
Every part of these abilities are kept weak because Shen's ult is STILL strong enough to make up for it.

Unfortunately his ult had a long long cooldown and is tricky to use. When used correctly though it amounts to free kills and towers.

I feel any attempt to change Shen's kit should start with changing his ult. It will be painful, but it needs to be done.

I'd change his ult by reducing its range cooldown, and channel time. Reduce the range to about 1 screen's length, perhaps 1600-2000 range units. (I eyeballed a range based on the maximum initiation range of Jarvan's EQR combo, or Zac's elastic slingshot. I'd then reduce the cooldown to something very very, very low. Something in the realm of maybe 20-40 seconds. Let him channel it in 1 second. All of this adds up to increase Shen's defensive mobility, allowing him to have a solid role in teamfights as a tank who swoops in to protect his allies in the nick of time. He gets to ult more, but shen actually has to spend time doing leg work to set up ganks or saves in skirmishing or splitpushing situations.
It is a complete nerf, and in a vacuum it looks like a kneecapping, but I feel its a better defined ult that allows for more strength to be put into shens base kit while still giving shen that superhero ninja moment, and with far greater frequency.

Successfully hitting your target with your Ki Strike while your target is marked you get another energy refun! Or maybe a kind of mark trigger to get some more damage?

Missed your taunt? Get the cooldown lower, but keep the energy cost, so you only have to make sure player actually learn how to manage their energy!

Any opinions of this guys? How can we keep his kit feel the same, while just making Shen more enjoyable?

Anyway, on a more serious note, I'd say at his core, Shen seems to be in a weird spot. He is a ninja, but he is a tank, that is about as oxymoronic as it gets. He should be tanky through things like being hard to catch or keep track of, not just stacking health and taking the beating head on. His kit should focus on durability through *avoiding* incoming damage, not just soaking it up. He should keep his ultimate *relatively* unchanged, because that is basically the reason to pick Shen right now (and that is its own issue). 

From what I've read from Rioter feed back, Shen's big problems (and why they are wont to buff him without reworking him) are that he lacks counter play and is low interaction to any opponent. They want to get rid of his Vorpal Blade in its current state because when he is good, it makes him unbearable to play against (so they say). The want to also rework his passive entirely along with his shield, because both are low interaction, and when the shield is strong, he is overbearing in lane, but when it is weak, he is rather wimpy. His taunt, while unique, is also just not that great. Taunt as a CC is a very sloppy, lazy form of CC since it just shows that the champ is weak and lousy enough in the rest of their kit that they need to literally FORCE the enemy to attack them instead of their allies. A good tank can soft taunt everyone on the enemy team through a combination of CC threat, burst, and/or damage blocking that makes killing all of their allies harder to kill (see Maokai, Sion, Amumu, Sejuani, Braum, etc.). A real tank is supposed to be *just* enough of a threat that they make it at least mostly worthwhile to try to kill them instead of your carries. Right now, Shen has a little bit of utility, moderate damage, and an ult that, while significantly helping allies out in a fight BEFORE he gets there, has 0 impact in terms of making the enemy ever have a reason to bother attacking him instead of anyone else on the once he arrives. 

Basically, His kit is extremely weak because of the excessive power of his ult, which is also badly designed in that it and the rest of his kit offers no reason that he would ever be worthy of attacking unless he built FULL AP and nuked you down somehow, which defeats the purpose of being a tank.
